H0.text: The 1950’s Mau Mau uprising was against the British occupation of which country. Tanzania

H1.text: The 1950’s Mau Mau uprising was against the British occupation of which country. Uganda

H2.text: The 1950’s Mau Mau uprising was against the British occupation of which country. South Africa

H3.text: The 1950’s Mau Mau uprising was against the British occupation of which country. Kenya

A4.text: The Mau Mau uprising set in play a series of events that expedited the road to Kenya's Independence.

A5.text: The British colonial authorities also implemented policies involving the incarceration of over 150,000 suspected Mau Mau members and sympathizers (mostly from the Kikuyu people) into concentration camps.
